---
title: "Official SDKs"
---

import { LinkCard, CardGrid, Card } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';


{/* import { Card, Cards } from '@components/index' */}

# Official SDKs
Use these Aptos software development kits (SDKs), in combination with the [Aptos CLI](cli.mdx) for your development on the Aptos blockchain.

<CardGrid>
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/ts-sdk" title="Typescript SDK" description={"Aptos Typescript SDK (recommended) ```sh pnpm i @aptos-labs/ts-sdk ```"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/python-sdk" title="Python SDK" description={"Aptos Python SDK ```sh pip3 install aptos-sdk ```"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/go-sdk" title="Go SDK" description={"Aptos Go SDK"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/dotnet-sdk" title="C#/.NET SDK" description={"Aptos .NET SDK ```sh dotnet add package Aptos ```"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/rust-sdk" title="Rust SDK" description={"Aptos Rust SDK"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/cpp-sdk" title="C++ / Unreal SDK" description={"Aptos C++ / Unreal SDK"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/unity-sdk" title="Unity SDK" description={"Aptos Unity SDK"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/wallet-adapter" title="Wallet Adapter" description={"Aptos Wallet Adapter"} />
</CardGrid>

## [Community SDKs](./sdks/community-sdks.mdx)

SDKs provided by the community for Aptos.  These may not be fully vetted by the
Aptos team, and may still be in development. They are still provided as a
resource for all developers.

<CardGrid>
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/community-sdks/kotlin-sdk" title="Kotlin SDK" description={"Aptos Kotlin Multiplatform SDK by Kaptos"} />
  <LinkCard href="./sdks/community-sdks/swift-sdk" title="Swift SDK" description={"Aptos Swift SDK by Alcove"} />
</CardGrid>
